sub_title: EU Head of Modelling and Analytics (Senior Director), HEOR at Lumanity
summary:
I am passionate about improving patient health on a global level, using mathematical models to study the natural history and control of diseases. With a background in academia, I pursue this passion for health economics at Lumanity since 2018 (when the company was known as BresMed), where I quickly progressed from junior health economist to EU Head of Modelling and Analytics. I am blessed to be working with a highly skilled team of health economists and statisticians located in the Netherlands, Ireland, and the UK, and working closely together with our colleagues in our offices in Germany, USA, and India. 

I strive to create an environment for the team in which we can reach our full potential and optimize client collaborations. With a strong believe that we should never stop learning, the appropriate set of challenges and the right level of support ensure growth in a non-stressful manner. And, importantly, it ensures that the team can develop in the direction they are passionate about and are proud to take ownership of. 

I am eager to work together proactively in search of a tailored solution for any challenge our clients may encounter. With my diverse background, I bring a creative perspective to the table to enable this search. Together we can define, develop and execute successful health economic and outcomes research strategies.  

Looking forward to connecting with you!

authors.headline: EU Head of Modelling and Analytics (Senior Director), HEOR at Lumanity

profile_positions.description:
I have expanded my role to EU Head of Modelling and Analytics, with team members consisting of health economists, statisticians and advance analytic specialists. The team members are based in the Netherlands, Ireland and the UK.  
In addition to my EU Head responsibilities, I am also responsible for our M&A Global Service Strategy and BD operations. Exciting new responsibilities that allow me to follow my passions for leadership, strategy, thought leadership and providing the right support for making new medical innovations available to patients.
profile_positions.title: EU Head of Modelling and Analytics, HEOR
Senior Director, Modelling and Analytics, HEOR

profile_positions.description:
As head of our health economics analysis teams in the Netherlands and Ireland since April 2021 (when the company was known as BresMed), I provide strategic advice to both the teams and our clients, and support recruitment, business development and planning. I strive to create an environment for the team in which we can reach our full potential and optimize client collaborations.

In addition to my regular EU Head responsibilities, I have also been involved in acquisition.
profile_positions.title: EU Head of Health Economics Analysis, HEOR

profile_positions.description: I am proud to be a Director at Lumanity since April 2021, back when the company was known as BresMed. Lumanity applies incisive thinking and decisive action to cut through complex situations and deliver transformative outcomes to accelerate and optimize access to medical advances. With deep experience in medical, commercial, and regulatory affairs, Lumanity transforms data and information into real-world insights and evidence that powers successful commercialization and empowers patients, providers, payers, and regulators to take timely and decisive action.
profile_positions.title: Director, Health Economics Analysis, HEOR

profile_positions.description: As head of our health economics analysis teams in the Netherlands and Ireland, I provide strategic advice to both the teams and our clients, and support recruitment, business development and planning. I strive to create an environment for the team in which we can reach our full potential and optimize client collaborations.
profile_positions.title: EU Head of Health Economics Analysis

profile_positions.description:
As a senior member of the Health Economics Analysis team, I have been involved as strategic lead, project lead and technical lead in different international modelling projects and advisory boards. These projects allowed me to gain experience in oncology, infectious diseases, dermatology, endocrine disorders, haematology, health policy, vaccination, inflammation and immunology, rare diseases, women's health, and non-disease specific consultancy and research. 

Furthermore, I am part of the business development team of BresMed Netherlands and the global BresMed Foundation committee.
profile_positions.title: Senior Health Economist

profile_positions.description:
At BresMed (http://www.bresmed.co.uk), we design, conduct, and report economic evaluations for a wide range of clients, including top pharmaceutical companies, medical device manufacturers and small biopharma at the global, European, and affiliate level.

The projects I have been involved in typically include cost-effectiveness, cost-minimization, and budget impact models.

For more information, please visit http://www.bresmed.com/.
profile_positions.title: Health Economist

profile_positions.description:
As a senior scientific researcher, I have been part of the Cancer Intervention and Surveillance Modeling Network (CISNET) for cervical cancer in the USA in collaboration with the Harvard T.H. Chan School of Public Health (USA), University of Minnesota (USA), University of Washington (USA), and the Cancer Council of New South Wales (Australia). 

The Cervical Working Group consists of five modeling groups and a coordinating center. The models incorporate the natural history pathway of human papillomavirus (HPV) infection to cervical cancer, and several of the models simulate the process of HPV acquisition and transmission. The groups’ interests include evaluating the benefits, harms, and costs of HPV vaccination and screening and identifying the most efficient, cost-effective strategies for cervical cancer control, including strategies in HIV positive women. The Cervical Group is also leveraging opportunities made possible by CISNET’s comparative modeling approach to disseminate findings and strengthen transparency, understanding, and confidence in model-based analyses of cervical cancer control strategies.
profile_positions.title: Senior scientific researcher

profile_positions.description:
I obtained my PhD at the department of Public Health at Erasmus MC in Rotterdam on 'The impact of HPV vaccination on HPV and cervical cancer in the Netherlands'. During the first year of my PhD, I obtained a Master’s degree in Health Sciences, specialization Public Health, at the Netherlands Institute of Health Sciences (NIHES) in Rotterdam. Besides my work on HPV and cervical cancer, I have worked for 1 month on a project on neglected tropical diseases, aimed at estimating the global health impact of meeting the WHO Roadmap targets. Furthermore, I have worked 10 months on a project on HIV combination prevention in Zimbabwe, for which I spent 2 months in Zimbabwe. During my stay there, I also gave lectures and workshops for the course “Mathematical Modeling Training”.

My primary areas of expertise are public health, health economics, life sciences and data analytics. 

In January 2017, I received the 'Encouragement Award for best PhD publication of 2016' from the Department of Public Health.
profile_positions.title: Scientific Researcher

profile_positions.description:
I was a (student) teaching and research assistant of two Professors at the department of Methodology and Statistics at Utrecht University.
This was a part-time job during my master which included both research (Bayesian modelling) and teaching (supervising master and bachelor students, practicals and making and checking the exams). The work during this part-time job led to a scientific publication.
profile_positions.title: Teaching and Research Assistant Methodology and Statistics

profile_positions.description:
Department of Methodology and Statistics.
Topic: "Professional respondents or volunteers? Data quality in internet panels."
The work during this internship led to oral presentations at two international conferences, one scientific publication, one book chapter, and two non-scientific articles.

company.name: Nederlandse Vereniging voor Technology Assessment in de Gezondheidszorg (NVTAG)

volunteer_experiences.description:
The Nederlandse Vereniging voor Technology Assessment in de Gezondheidszorg (NVTAG; Dutch Association for Technology Assessment in Healthcare) has been the platform for the evaluation of healthcare technology since 1995. The NVTAG supports research and education for the evaluation of the medical, societal and economical impact of the use of technologies in healthcare.

For more information, see https://www.nvtag.nl/.
